name: Bellini
method: Pour peach purée into chilled glass, add sparkling wine. Stir gently.
notes: Traditionally a Bellini uses white peaches for the fruit.

name: Black Russian
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Pour the ingredients into the old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

name: Bloody Mary
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Stirring gently, pour all ingredients into highball glass. Garnish.

name: Caipirinha
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Place lime and sugar into a double old fashioned glass and muddle gently. Fill the glass with cracked ice and add Cachaça. Stir gently to involve ingredients.
notes: Caipiroska – instead of cachaça use vodka

name: Champagne cocktail
method: Add dash of Angostura bitter onto sugar cube and drop it into champagne flute. Add cognac followed by gently pouring chilled champagne. Garnish with orange slice and maraschino cherry.

name: Corpse reviver #2
method: Shake ingredients together in a mixer with ice. Strain into chilled glass. Garnish with orange zest.

name: Cosmopolitan
method: Shake all ingredients in cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a large cocktail glass. Garnish with lime slice.
notes: The drink should be a frothy bright pink color

name: Cuba libre
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

name: French 75
method: Combine gin, syrup, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled champagne glass. Top up with champagne. Stir gently.
ingredients: 15 ml (0.51 US fl oz) lemon juice
15 ml (0.51 US fl oz) simple syrup

name: French Connection
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

name: Golden dream
method: Shake with cracked ice.  Strain into glass and serve.

name: Grasshopper
method: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake briskly and then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Hemingway special
method: Pour all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake.

name: Horse's neck
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Pour brandy and ginger ale directly into highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently. Garnish with lemon zest. If desired, add dashes of Angostura Bitter.

name: Irish coffee
method: Pour the coffee into a preheated glass, add whiskey and sugar, and stir until dissolved. Pour cream slowly to form a distinct layer.

name: Kir
method: Add the crème de cassis to the bottom of the glass, then top up with wine.
notes: A recipe can be found at the International Bartenders Association website.

name: Long Island iced tea
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Add all ingredients into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Optionally garnish with lemon slice.

name: Mai Tai
method: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake and pour into a double rocks glass or a highball glass.
notes: The Martinique molasses rum used by Trader Vic was not an Agricole rum but a type of "rummy" from molasses.

name: Margarita
method: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Mimosa
method: Ensure both ingredients are well chilled, then mix into the glass. Serve cold.

name: Mint julep
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: In a highball glass gently muddle the mint, sugar and water. Fill the glass with cracked ice, add Bourbon and stir well until the glass is well frosted. Garnish with a mint sprig.
ingredients: 6 cL (2.0 US fl oz) bourbon whiskey

name: Mojito
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Mix mint sprigs with sugar and lime juice. Add splash of soda water and fill the glass with ice
ingredients: 2 teaspoons white cane sugar (or 2 cl of sugar syrup)

name: Moscow mule
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Combine vodka and ginger beer in a highball glass filled with ice. Add lime juice. Stir gently. Garnish.

name: Pisco sour
method: Vigorously shake contents in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, then strain into a glass and garnish with bitters.
ingredients: Several drops of aromatic bitters at the end

name: Piña colada
method: Blend all the ingredients with ice in an electric blender, pour into a large goblet or Hurricane glass and serve.

name: Sea breeze
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

name: Sex on the beach
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with orange slice.

name: Singapore sling
method: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into Hurricane glass.

name: Tequila sunrise
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Pour the tequila and orange juice into glass over ice.  Add the grenadine, which will sink to the bottom.  Stir gently to create the sunrise effect.  Garnish and serve.

name: Vesper
method: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Zombie
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Mix ingredients in a shaker with crushed ice and shake. Pour into a tall tumbler glass.
notes: Because of the high proof rum, this cocktail could be lit if desired.
ingredients: 15 ml Donn's Mix (2 parts fresh white grapefruit juice and 1 part cinnamon syrup)

name: Barracuda
method: Shake pour ingredients with ice. Strain into glass, top with sparkling wine.

name: Bee's knees
method: Combine gin, honey syrup and lemon juice into a mixing tin. Shake. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with lemon peel.

name: Bramble
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker except the Crème de Mûre, shake well with ice, strain into chilled old fashioned glass filled with crushed ice, then pour the blackberry liqueur (Crème de Mûre) over the top of the drink, in a circular motion.

name: Canchanchara
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Mix honey with water and lime juice and spread the mixture on the bottom and sides of the glass. Add cracked ice, and then the rum. End by energetically stirring from bottom to top.

name: Dark 'n' stormy
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: In a highball glass filled with ice pour the ginger beer and top floating with the Rum.
notes: Garnish with a lime wedge or slice.
ingredients: 60 ml Goslings Rum100 ml Ginger Beer

name: Espresso martini
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Fernandito
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Fill a double old-fashioned glass with ice. Pour in the Fernet-Branca, fill the glass with cola. Stir gently.

name: French martini
method: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink.

name: Illegal
served:
Served in one of two ways:
Straight up (no ice) in a chilled cocktail glass
On the rocks (over ice) in a traditional clay or terracotta mug
method: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake vigorously. Strain into chilled cocktail glass, or "on the rocks" into a traditional clay or terracotta mug.

name: Lemon drop martini
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with sugar rim around the glass.

name: Naked and famous
method: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: New York sour
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Pour the whiskey, syrup, lemon juice, and egg white into shaker with ice cubes. Shake vigorously. Strain into chilled rocks glass filled with ice. Float the wine on top. Garnish with lemon or orange zest and cherry.

name: Old Cuban
method: Pour all ingredients except the wine into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled elegant cocktail glass. Top up with the sparkling wine and garnish with mint sprigs

name: Paloma
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Pour the tequila into a highball glass, squeeze the lime juice. Add ice and salt, fill up pink grapefruit soda. Stir gently.

name: Paper plane
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Penicillin
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Muddle fresh ginger in a shaker and add the remaining ingredients, except for the Lagavulin whisky. Fill the shaker with ice and shake. Double-strain into a chilled old fashioned glass with ice. Float the Lagavulin whisky on top.

name: Russian spring punch
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker except the sparkling wine, shake well with ice, strain into chilled tall tumbler glass filled with ice and top up with sparkling wine.

name: Southside
method: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, double-strain into chilled cocktail glass
notes: If egg white is used shake vigorously

name: Spritz
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Build all ingredients into a wine glass filled with ice. Stir gently.

name: Suffering bastard
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Shake everything but ginger beer with ice, pour unstrained into glass, top with ginger beer.

name: Tipperary
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of orange.

name: Tommy's margarita
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into a chilled rocks glass filled with ice.
ingredients: 30 ml Agave syrup (1⁄2 water + 1⁄2 agave nectar)

name: Trinidad sour
method: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Ve.n.to
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Pour all ingredients into the shaker. Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into a chilled small tumbler glass filled with ice.
notes: If desired, the water used to make the honey mix can be replaced by chamomile infusion.
ingredients: 1.5 cl honey mix (made with chamomile infusion if desired)

name: Yellow bird
method: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass

name: Alexander
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Americano
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Pour the Campari and vermouth over ice into an old fashioned glass, add a splash of soda water and garnish with half orange slice and a lemon twist.

name: Angel face
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Aviation
method: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.

name: Between the sheets
method: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes, shake, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Boulevardier
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Brandy crusta
method: Mix all ingredients with ice cubes in a mixing glass.  Strain into slim cocktail glass rimmed with sugar.

name: Casino
method: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and a maraschino cherry. Serve without a straw.

name: Clover Club
method: Dry shake ingredients to emulsify, add ice, shake and served straight up.
ingredients: 1 egg white or 20 ml aquafaba or 4 drops cocktail foamer

name: Daiquiri
method: In a cocktail shaker add all ingredients. Stir well to dissolve the sugar. Add ice and shake. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Dry martini
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled martini cocktail glass.
notes: Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with green olives if requested.
ingredients: 10 ml (0.34 US fl oz) dry vermouth

name: Gin fizz
method: Shake all ingredients with ice cubes, except soda water. Pour into glass. Top with soda water.

name: Hanky panky
method: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served up.

name: John Collins
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Pour all ingredients directly into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish. Add a dash of Angostura bitters.
ingredients: 3 cl (2 parts) freshly squeezed lemon juice

name: Last word
method: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Manhattan
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Martinez
method: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served up.

name: Mary Pickford
method: Shake and strain into a chilled large cocktail glass

name: Monkey gland
method: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Negroni
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Stir into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

name: Old fashioned
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Place sugar cube in old fashioned glass and saturate with bitter, add few dashes of plain water. Muddle until dissolved. Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey. Stir gently. Garnish with orange slice or zest, and a cocktail cherry.

name: Paradise
method: Shake together over ice.  Strain into cocktail glass and serve chilled.

name: Planter's punch
method: Pour all ingredients directly in a small tumbler or a typical terracotta glass.
notes: Add dilution up to taste, it can be given by water, ice or fresh juices.

name: Porto flip
method: Shake ingredients together in a mixer with ice.  Strain into glass, garnish and serve

name: Ramos fizz
method: All ingredients except the soda are poured in a mixing glass, dry shaken (no ice) for two minutes, then ice is added and shaken hard for another minute. Strain into a highball glass without ice and topped with soda.

name: Rusty nail
served: On the rocks: poured over ice
method: Pour all ingredients directly into an old fashioned glass filled with ice. Stir gently.

name: Sazerac
method: Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with the absinthe, add crushed ice, and set it aside. Stir the remaining ingredients over ice and set it aside. Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass, and strain the drink into the glass. Add the lemon peel for garnish.
notes: Note: The original recipe changed in the latter part of the 19th century. Rye whiskey was substituted when cognac became difficult to obtain.[2]

name: Sidecar
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass.

name: Stinger
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled martini cocktail glass.
notes: It has been suggested that during the 1920s the stinger ceased being an after-dinner cocktail, and instead should be consumed before dinner.[1] However, until recently the IBA listed the stinger as an after-dinner cocktail.

name: Tuxedo
method: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.  Garnish with a cherry and a twist of lemon zest.

name: Vieux Carré
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Whiskey sour
served: On the rocks or straight up
method: Shake with ice. Strain into chilled glass, garnish and serve.
notes: If served 'On the rocks', strain ingredients into old-fashioned glass filled with ice.

name: White lady
method: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into large cocktail glass.
notes: This cocktail is a variant of the Sidecar
